channel.title: Note on Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Note on Blog

item.title: Socat - host forwarding
item.description: So I have a situtation that there is MySQL instance running at 198.168.100.100:34357. The host IP is difficult to remember, the port number is just something random. It would be easier for me to receive all traffics for MySQL at some localhost:3306 port. 3306 is the default port for MySQL. And the fact that I’m using OSX makes things a bit harder, the nc netcat in OSX doesn’t work the same way as Linux nc.

item.title: Git HEAD with caret and tilde
item.description: HEAD~ or HEAD~1 refer to the parent of the commit. HEAD~2 refer to the parents of parent of the commit, aka. grandparent HEAD^ or HEAD^1 refer to the first parent of the commit. HEAD^2 refers to the second parent of the commit. Suppose that I have a git repository like this >> git log --graph --oneline * c6ca995 (HEAD -> master) three.txt in master branch * 9997436 Merge branch 'two' |\ | * 0dda652 (two) two.
